action.action-desc: Ms. DelBene (for herself, Mr. Kind, Mr. Ruppersberger, and Ms. Kuster of New Hampshire) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to expand and modify the credit for employee health insurance expenses of small employers.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Small Business Tax Credit Accessibility Act.

section.header: Expansion and modification of credit for employee health insurance expenses of small employers

subsection.header: Expansion of definition of eligible small employer
subsection.text: Subparagraph (A) of section 45R(d)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking 25 and inserting 50.
Subsection (c) of section 45R of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to read as follows:

subsection.header: Phaseout of credit amount based on number of employees and average wages
subsection.text: The amount of the credit determined under subsection (b) (without regard to this subsection) shall be adjusted (but not below zero) by multiplying such amount by the product of—

subparagraph.text: a fraction the numerator of which is the excess (if any) of 50 over the total number of full-time equivalent employees of the employer and the denominator of which is 30, and

clause.text: the numerator of which is the excess (if any) of—

subclause.text: the dollar amount in effect under subsection (d)(3)(B) for the taxable year, multiplied by 3, over
the average annual wages of the employer for such taxable year, and

clause.text: the denominator of which is the dollar amount so in effect under subsection (d)(3)(B), multiplied by 2, and

subsection.text: Paragraph (2) of section 45R(e) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking 2-consecutive-taxable year period and all that follows and inserting “3-consecutive-taxable year period beginning with the first taxable year beginning after 2014 in which—

subparagraph.text: the employer (or any predecessor) offers one or more qualified health plans to its employees through an Exchange, and
the employer (or any predecessor) claims the credit under this section.

subsection.text: Subparagraph (B) of section 45R(d)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: For purposes of paragraph (1)(B) and subsection (c)(2), the dollar amount in effect under this paragraph is the amount equal to 110 percent of the poverty line (within the meaning of section 36B(d)(3)) for a family of 4.

subsection.header: Elimination of uniform percentage contribution requirement
subsection.text: Paragraph (4) of section 45R(d) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking a uniform percentage (not less than 50 percent) and inserting at least 50 percent.

subsection.header: Elimination of cap relating to average local premiums
subsection.text: Subsection (b) of section 45R of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking the lesser of and all that follows and inserting the aggregate amount of nonelective contributions the employer made on behalf of its employees during the taxable year under the arrangement described in subsection (d)(4) for premiums for qualified health plans offered by the employer to its employees through an Exchange..

subsection.header: Conforming amendment relating to annual wage limitation
subsection.text: Subparagraph (B) of section 45R(d)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking twice and inserting three times.
The amendments made by this section shall apply to amounts paid or incurred in taxable years beginning after December 31, 2016.
